org.opengrok.indexer.configuration

Class RuntimeEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opengrok.indexer.configuration.RuntimeEnvironment

  • public final class RuntimeEnvironment
extends Object
    The RuntimeEnvironment class is used as a placeholder for the current configuration this execution context (classloader) is using.

      • getPathRelativeToSourceRoot

        public String getPathRelativeToSourceRoot(File file)
                                   throws IOException,
                                          ForbiddenSymlinkException
        Returns a path relative to source root. This would just be a simple substring operation, except we need to support symlinks outside the source root.
        Parameters:
        file - A file to resolve
        Returns:
        Path relative to source root
        Throws:
        IOException - If an IO error occurs
        FileNotFoundException - if the file is not relative to source root or if sourceRoot is not defined
        ForbiddenSymlinkException - if symbolic-link checking encounters an ineligible link

      • getCtags

        public String getCtags()
        Gets the name of the ctags program to use: either the last value passed successfully to setCtags(java.lang.String), or Configuration.getCtags(), or the system property for "org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.Ctags", or "ctags" as a default.
        Returns:
        a defined value

      • setCtags

        public void setCtags(String ctags)
        Sets the name of the ctags program to use, or resets to use the fallbacks documented for getCtags().

        N.b. the value is not mediated to Configuration.

        Parameters:
        ctags - a defined value or null to reset to use the Configuration.getCtags() fallbacks
        See Also:
        getCtags()

      • getMandoc

        public String getMandoc()
        Gets the name of the mandoc program to use: either the last value passed successfully to setMandoc(java.lang.String), or Configuration.getMandoc(), or the system property for "org.opengrok.indexer.analysis.Mandoc", or null as a default.
        Returns:
        a defined instance or null

      • setMandoc

        public void setMandoc(String value)

        N.b. the value is not mediated to Configuration.

        Parameters:
        value - a defined value or null to reset to use the Configuration.getMandoc() fallbacks
        See Also:
        getMandoc()

        public void setRepositories(String dir)

      • setDefaultProjectsFromNames

        public void setDefaultProjectsFromNames(Set<String> defaultProjects)
        Set the specified projects as default in the configuration. This method should be called only after projects were discovered and became part of the configuration, i.e. after Indexer.prepareIndexer(org.opengrok.indexer.configuration.RuntimeEnvironment, boolean, boolean, boolean, java.util.List<java.lang.String>, java.util.List<java.lang.String>) was called.
        Parameters:
        defaultProjects - The default project to use
        See Also:
        setDefaultProjects(java.util.Set<org.opengrok.indexer.configuration.Project>)

      • setDefaultProjects

        public void setDefaultProjects(Set<Project> defaultProjects)
        Set the projects that are specified to be the default projects to use. The default projects are the projects you will search (from the web application) if the page request didn't contain the cookie..
        Parameters:
        defaultProjects - The default project to use

      • getDefaultProjects

        public Set<Project> getDefaultProjects()
        Get the projects that are specified to be the default projects to use. The default projects are the projects you will search (from the web application) if the page request didn't contain the cookie..
        Returns:
        the default projects (may be null if not specified)

      • getRamBufferSize

        public double getRamBufferSize()
        Returns:
        at what size (in MB) we should flush the buffer

      • setRamBufferSize

        public void setRamBufferSize(double ramBufferSize)
        Set the size of buffer which will determine when the docs are flushed to disk. Specify size in MB please. 16MB is default note that this is per thread (lucene uses 8 threads by default in 4.x)
        Parameters:
        ramBufferSize - the size(in MB) when we should flush the docs

      • maybeRefreshIndexSearchers

        public void maybeRefreshIndexSearchers(Iterable<String> projects)

      • maybeRefreshIndexSearchers

        public void maybeRefreshIndexSearchers()

      • getIndexSearcher

        public SuperIndexSearcher getIndexSearcher(String projectName)
                                    throws IOException
        Get IndexSearcher for given project. Each IndexSearcher is born from a SearcherManager object. There is one SearcherManager for every project. This schema makes it possible to reuse IndexSearcher/IndexReader objects so the heavy lifting (esp. system calls) performed in FSDirectory and DirectoryReader happens only once for a project. The caller has to make sure that the IndexSearcher is returned back to the SearcherManager. This is done with returnIndexSearcher(). The return of the IndexSearcher should happen only after the search result data are read fully.
        Parameters:
        projectName - project
        Returns:
        SearcherManager for given project
        Throws:
        IOException - I/O exception

      • refreshSearcherManagerMap

        public void refreshSearcherManagerMap()
        After new configuration is put into place, the set of projects might change so we go through the SearcherManager objects and close those where the corresponding project is no longer present.

      • getMultiReader

        public org.apache.lucene.index.MultiReader getMultiReader(SortedSet<String> projects,
                                                          ArrayList<SuperIndexSearcher> searcherList)
        Return collection of IndexReader objects as MultiReader object for given list of projects. The caller is responsible for releasing the IndexSearcher objects so we add them to the map.
        Parameters:
        projects - list of projects
        searcherList - each SuperIndexSearcher produced will be put into this list
        Returns:
        MultiReader for the projects
